txt.en: Léofdag fell during the Battle of the Hornburg, but proved his worth with his sacrifice.
Burnoth is at the Hornburg.\n\nYou should speak with Burnoth again.
'It was a glorious battle, was it not? Hopeless, yet not without hope. Léofdag acquitted himself with honour....'
'You have been a good and true friend, [placeholder]. There is a task I would beg of you, if you have the time....'
Burnoth is at the Hornburg.\n\nBurnoth wants you to join in the memorial for Léofdag, who fell at the Battle of the Hornburg.
Speak with Burnoth and the Riders about Léofdag's heroism at the Battle of the Hornburg

'Ah, [placeholder], it is a sad passing...the Riddermark has lost one of its greatest Riders, and more importantly, we have lost a good friend. Do you recall the valour with which he defended the Hornburg? Let us speak of his final stand as a memorial to his courage and honour....'
